title: El Morro National Monument: Park Home
body: Paso por aqui...  Imagine the comfort and refreshment of finding water after days of dusty travel. A reliable waterhole hidden at the base of a sandstone bluff made El Morro (the headland) a popular campsite for hundreds of years. Here, Ancestral Puebloans, Spanish and American travelers carved over 2,000 signatures, dates, messages, and petroglyphs. We invite you to make El Morro a stopping point on your travels.                Trails   El Morro offers hiking and walking opportunities on our beautiful trails.        Ranger Programs   Join a ranger guided program to learn more about the history of El Morro.
